HPM 883: Advanced Quantitative Methods

Spring 2026 | UNC Gillings School of Global Public Health

Welcome

HPM 883 is an advanced graduate-level course designed to equip PhD students in Health Policy and Management with sophisticated quantitative research skills. This course is the third installment in the quantitative methods sequence, building on foundations from HPM 881 and HPM 882.

Focus Areas:

  • Experimental design and randomization inference
  • Double/Debiased Machine Learning (DML)
  • Heterogeneous treatment effects and causal forests
  • Policy learning and optimal treatment rules
  • Modern causal inference methods (DiD, synthetic controls)

Course Details

Instructor Sean Sylvia
Meeting Time Mon/Wed 11:15am - 12:30pm
Location Rosenau 228 / Zoom (hybrid)
Office Hours Wed 2:00-4:00pm
Credits 3

Announcements

NoteWeek 1: January 7-14, 2026

Welcome to HPM 883! Please complete the following before our first class:

  1. Review the syllabus
  2. Complete computing setup
  3. Join the Slack workspace (link in Canvas)
  4. Accept Lab 0 on GitHub Classroom — due Jan 19

Course Units

Unit Topic Weeks
0 Foundations: Potential Outcomes & DAGs 1
1 Experimental Design 2-3
2 Double/Debiased ML & Doubly-Robust Estimation 4-6
3 Heterogeneous Treatment Effects & Causal Forests 7-8
4 Policy Learning 9
5 Observational Causal ML 10
6 DiD & Synthetic Controls 11
7 Advanced Topics 12
8 Integration & Capstone 13-14

Assessment Overview

Component Weight
Problem Sets 30%
Design Memos (2) 20%
Capstone Project 40%
Peer Review 10%

See Syllabus for full details.
